entry.title: SAP Practice and Certification Journey
entry.content:
In todayâ€™s fast-evolving logistics industry, digital transformation and integrated systems play a critical role in ensuring efficiency, transparency, and sustainability. As someone who has received formal education in logistics and is actively continuing my professional development in this field, I strongly believe that learning SAP S/4HANA Transportation Management (TM) is a natural and strategic step in my career journey.

My motivation to learn SAP stems from my desire to deepen my understanding of logistics beyond operational processes and into system-driven decision making. Transportation Management is one of the core pillars of supply chain operations, and SAP S/4HANA TM provides an end-to-end perspectiveâ€”from planning and execution to cost settlement and performance analysis. Gaining hands-on practice with this system will allow me to better understand how logistics processes are designed, optimized, and managed within global organizations.

Additionally, learning SAP S/4HANA TM will help me develop a more analytical and structured mindset. Exposure to different ERP systems not only enhances technical competence but also enables logistics professionals to think holistically, connecting operations, finance, and strategy. I believe this knowledge will significantly contribute to my ability to analyze complex logistics scenarios and propose effective, data-driven solutions.

Through SAP Practice and Certification, my goal is to strengthen my professional skill set, bridge the gap between theory and real-world applications, and position myself as a more capable and future-ready logistics profession

entry.content:
Hi team,

We are using IDM to manage our user provisioning. As we are implementing SNC, we got a requirement to deactivate password during the new user creation. We are using BAPI_USER_CHANGE to set the password .We are trying to deactivate the password now, but the field LOGONDATA-CODVN is an internal field only.

 

Please suggest how to deactivate the password for users through the BAPI.





------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Password deactivation through BAPI_USER_CHANGE
entry.content:
Hi,

 

for deactivating a password it is allowed exceptionally, to set LOGONDATA_CODVN and LOGONDATAX_CODVN to the value X. You need to leave all other password related fields as they are, to avoid error messages.

This exception is documented in SAP note #780485 .

 

b.rgds, Bernhard

entry.title: Re: Best Practice for Adjusting Project Progress Percenta...
entry.content:
Hello @Minsung_Lee 

Thank you for your question. See my response on each.

My Questions:

1. Is adjusting Plan values the correct approach for mid-project progress reconciliation, or should I be using ETC adjustments instead?

Answer: No. You should use ETC adjustments, not plan manipulation in this scenario. The standard process is a monthly review where you review your PoC and adjust the estimate to complete in the Review Customer Projects app. See Analyzing the Process Steps for Customer Project Management for more details.

2. What is the SAP-recommended standard practice for ongoing progress alignment when external progress differs from system-calculated PoC?

Answer: Revenue recognition that is event based derives cost based on PoC and it uses planned cost, actuals and your forecast values, so changing to plan just to force a percent will distort the finance logic. See Customer Projects with Event-Based Revenue Recognition.

3. Should I be using forecast month settings systematically throughout the project lifecycle rather than only at project closure?

Answer: Yes, you should use Forecast Month because, the apps evaluate KPIs and checks the deviation up to the month you forecasted for and the system determines ETC/EAC while it considers your deviations from adjustments you made in preceding periods. See KBA 3617498, Transfer Project Forecast to Finance and Review Customer Projects for more guidance.

Also, this document provides application job specifically to set the forecast month for customer projects. https://help.sap.com/doc/7c9e0bbbd1664c2581b2038a1c7ae4b3/2602.500/en-US/FSD_CE2602.pdf

I recommend you stick to the standard practice:

  1. Set Forecast Month monthly for projects.
  2. Review Customer Projects, align your process by adjusting ETC and not by changing plan.
  3. What are the risks or downstream impacts of frequently modifying Plan values vs. ETC values?
  4. Use Transfer Project Forecast to Finance to keep forecast and feed your finance.
  5. Run Event Based Revenue Recognition as per your closing cycle to post revenue based on your latest PoC and forecasts

4. What are the risks or downstream impacts of frequently modifying Plan values vs. ETC values?

Answer:

If you frequently modify your Plan values,

  • you risk blurring the meaning of plan versus baseline, budget and variance.
  • You can create misleading cost based PoC and your revenue recognitions results because plan is an input to PoC. See Customer Projects with Event-Based Revenue Recognition

Should you adjust ECT values

  • You keep plan as a planning baseline and use ETC as your operational forecast lever.
  • The system expects ETC adjustments to ensure your forecast deviations are handled across the periods. See Transfer Project Forecast to Finance and Review Customer Projects for more guidance.

Question 5 is answered with the provided references.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Happy New Year and Happy Coding of AI Agents!
entry.content:
I hope everyone found their way into the new year and had some peaceful time over the holidays! Being back at work, I started to try out all the cool announcements from last year. One of them is LiteLLM, where SAP contributed to function as an official LLM provider. That means you can now build AI Agents with the LiteLLM gateway and all the AI Agent frameworks that are compatible and provide your Generative AI Hub credentials to connect to LLMs via SAP's AI Foundation.

I tried out CrewAI first because it is such a powerful and widely used framework and I have been curious and willing to try it out for some time now!

First things first: What is LiteLLM?

LiteLLM is a library that provides a unified, provider-agnostic API for calling large language models (LLMs) and handling common tasks (completion, chat, streaming, multimodal inputs). It standardizes request/response handling and includes utilities that speed up integration with agent frameworks and tooling. Essentially it is a gateway between LLM providers and AI Agent frameworks.

That means you can use your Generative AI Hub credentials to build state of the art AI Agents with any of the models available through GenAI Hub and any of the AI Agent frameworks compatible with LiteLLM. This combination is extremely powerful because that means you can use LLMs hosted or managed by SAP (Mistral, Llama, Nvidia) and models from our partners such as Azure OpenAI, Amazon Bedrock (including Anthropic) and Gemini.

ðŸ‘‰check all the available models here: https://me.sap.com/notes/3437766

ðŸ‘‰And all the AI Agent frameworks including: CrewAI, LangGraph, PydanticAI, Google ADK, Strands SDK, OpenAI ADK, LlamaIndex, Microsoft Agents and many more. You can find a list with examples here: http://sap-contributions.github.io/litellm-agentic-examples/

How to get started

Now to get started you need an SAP AI Core instance with the extended plan (on SAP BTP), that means you have access to Generative AI Hub and all the LLMs available.

SAP BTP Cockpit, Instances and Subscriptions, SAP AI Core â€“ extended plan

LiteLLM is directing calls to the LLMs through the orchestration service on Generative AI Hub. That means you do not need to deploy your models on SAP AI Core. You only need the out of the box deployment of the orchestration service. This way you can easily switch between all the models available via the orchestration service.

Screenshot from Model Library of SAP AI Launchpad showing models available via Orchestration Service.

 On a side note: you do not need SAP AI Launchpad as the UI to do any of this. You can also find your endpoints via API calls (more info: developer tutorial or documentation). or use the SAP Cloud SDK for AI.

Build your crew of agents

Now you only need to install Python. Once that is done you need to install the LiteLLM library and in my case also CrewAI:

pip install litellm crewai

Ok now we can actually start with building our AI Agent with CrewAI. As the name suggests you build a crew of agents that have a set of tools available to accomplish certain tasks. CrewAI uses tasks to bridge the gap between high-level goals and concrete agent actions, assigning specific objectives and expected outputs.

Agents

CrewAI recommends storing your agent configuration in and agents.yaml file. Important are the parameters: role, goal, backstory and llm. The parameter llm defines which LLM provider you want to use. We want to use SAP as the provider and GPT-4o as the model (provider/model -> sap/gpt-4o). As already described above you can use any model here that is available via the orchestration service. {payload} is a variable that will be filled during runtime.

theft_crime_scene_investigator:
  role: >
    Theft Crime Scene Investigator
  goal: >
    Predict the missing values of stolen items using the SAP-RPT-1 model via the call_rpt1 tool use this payload {payload} as input.
  backstory: >
    An expert theft crime investigator specialised on predicting the value of stolen luxury goods.
  llm: sap/gpt-4o

Tasks

In the tasks.yaml you define the name of the task, the description, the expected output and which agent can do this task. {payload} is again the variable that will be filled during runtime.

inspection_task:
  description: >
    Analyze the theft crime scene and predict the missing values of stolen items using the SAP-RPT-1 model via the call_rpt1 tool. 
    Use this dict {payload} as input.
  expected_output: >
    JSON with predicted values for the stolen items.
  agent: theft_crime_scene_investigator

Tools

You can also define custom tools in Python and hand them over to your agents to use. The following tool for example gives the model access to the SAP-RPT-1 model (try it out here: rpt.cloud.sap).

from rpt1.call_rpt1 import RPT1Client

rpt1_client = RPT1Client()

@tool("call_rpt1")
def call_rpt1(payload: dict) -> str:
    """Function to call RPT-1 model via RPT1Client"""
    response = rpt1_client.post_request(json_payload=payload)
    if response.status_code == 200:
        return response.json()
    else:
        return f"Error: {response.status_code} - {response.text}"

If you want to know more about how to make the request to SAP-RPT-1 check out this code.

Building the Crew

You might wonder how this all comes together? Now you plug all those pieces together and build your crew. The crew needs at least one agent, but can have more, any tools you want the agent to use, you can also assign here. And each agent has at least one task.

from crewai import Agent, Crew, Task, Process
from crewai.project import CrewBase, agent, task, crew, tool

@CrewBase
class MurderMystery():
    """MurderMystery crew"""

    agents_config = "config/agents.yaml"
    tasks_config = 'config/tasks.yaml'

    
    def theft_crime_scene_investigator(self) -> Agent:
        return Agent(
            config=self.agents_config['theft_crime_scene_investigator'], 
            verbose=True,
            tools=[call_rpt1]
        )

    
    def inspection_task(self) -> Task:
        return Task(
            config=self.tasks_config['inspection_task'] # type: ignore[index]
        )

    @crew
    def crew(self) -> Crew:
        return Crew(
            agents=self.agents,  # Automatically collected by the  decorator
            tasks=self.tasks,    # Automatically collected by the  decorator.
            process=Process.sequential,
            verbose=True,
        )

Run the crew

murder_mystery = MurderMystery()
result = murder_mystery.crew().kickoff(inputs={'payload': payload})
print("\nðŸ“˜ Result:\n", result)

 

Additional Infos

  • If you need any help in setting up your Python environment, check out the exercise 02 -Setup Python environment from my CodeJam.
  • Full code here: https://github.com/noravth/agentic-ai-codejam-collection
  • Documentation SAP and LiteLLM 

Happy Coding and feel free to reach out anytime!

entry.title: Re: Customizing the Company Profitability Review Booklet in Margin Analysis
entry.content:
HI David,

in the cube we have:

key _CurrencyField.CurrencyField as CurrencyField,

//Currency

cast( case $projection.CurrencyField

when 'CCC ' then CompanyCodeCurrency

when 'GC' then GlobalCurrency

when 'FC' then FunctionalCurrency

else null end as waers_curc preserving type ) as Currency,

 

//Amount in Display Currency

@Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'Currency'

cast( case $projection.CurrencyField

when 'CCC' then AmountInCompanyCodeCurrency

when 'GC' then AmountInGlobalCurrency

when 'FC' then AmountInFunctionalCurrency

else null end as farp_amount_display_crcy ) as AmountInDisplayCurrency,

 

@Aggregation.default: #SUM

@Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'Currency'

cast(( $projection.AmountInDisplayCurrency * -1 ) as fis_hsl_inverted) as InvertedAmountInDisplayCrcy,

 

In the query we then select restricted, e.g.:

@AnalyticsDetails.query.axis: #ROWS

@AnalyticsDetails.query.elementHierarchy.parent: 'NetRevenueAmountInDspCrcy'

@Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'Currency'

@EndUserText.label : 'Sales Deduction'

@UI.textArrangement: #TEXT_LAST

cast( case when ( SemanticTag = 'SALES_DED' )

then ( InvertedAmountInDisplayCrcy )

else null end as fins_sales_deduction preserving type ) as SalesDeductionAmountInDspCrcy,

 

Best regards,

Roman

entry.title: The credit card number is saved in encrypted format in the SAP B1 backend table.
entry.content:
In SAP Business One, credit card numbers are stored in encrypted form in backend tables. However, the last four digits are visible at the UI level.

Is there any standard way (query, SDK, or Service Layer) to retrieve at least the last four digits of the credit card number from SAP B1?

If direct access from the database is not possible, is there any supported API or object that provides the masked/last four digits?

entry.title: How to use BAPI_SALESORDER_CHANGE properly? Encountered CX_SY_DYN_ILLEGAL_CALL_TYPE
entry.content:
I am encountering a dump of CX_SY_DYN_ILLEGAL_CALL_TYPE when using the BAPI_SALESORDER_CHANGE. It is my first time to use this.
I am trying to pass specific fields from contract document into sales document but for now, i am trying to pass a specific value in sales document when the contract document is saved. 

  DATA: ls_header_in    TYPE bapisdhd1,
        ls_header_inx   TYPE bapisdhd1x,
        lt_return       TYPE TABLE OF bapiret2,
        ls_return       TYPE bapiret2,
        lv_salesdocnum  TYPE vbeln_va, 
        lv_has_error    TYPE abap_bool.

  IF xvbak-auart <> 'ZVCC'.
    RETURN.
  ENDIF.

  " Get related sales order
  SELECT SINGLE vbeln
    FROM vbfa
    WHERE vbelv = @xvbak-vbeln
      AND vbtyp_n = 'C'
      AND vbtyp_v = 'G'
    INTO _salesdocnum. 

  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    RETURN.
  ENDIF.

  CLEAR: ls_header_in, 
         ls_header_inx, 
         lt_return.

  " Set values
  ls_header_in-purch_no_c  = 'ZTEST_CHANGE01'.
  ls_header_inx-purch_no_c = 'X'.
  ls_header_inx-updateflag = 'U'.

  CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_SALESORDER_CHANGE'
    EXPORTING
      salesdocument    = lv_salesdocnum 
      order_header_in  = ls_header_in    
      order_header_inx = ls_header_inx   
    TABLES
      return           = lt_return.

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA for Group Reporting - Using Automatic Posting Rules for Consolidation of Investments
entry.content:
Introduction

Automating postings in SAP S/4HANA Group Reporting dramatically reduces manual effort and increases accuracy in financial consolidation. With release 2508.3, you can define posting rules specifically for consolidation groups and automate group-level postings such as the consolidation of investments.

 

What's New for Consolidation Group Postings

Automatic posting rules (you can find more details in this introduction blog) for consolidation group postings now include the following features:

  • Group Structure Filters to select the units based on their assignment in the group structure.
  • Field assignment for Investee Unit to maintain investor-investee relationships in postings.
  • An enhanced log with a new tab to display the log items per investee unit and a quick link to display group structure assignment details.

 

Scenarios

Here are some typical examples of group postings that you can automate for the consolidation of investments:

  • First consolidation: elimination of investments, capital, retained earnings, other comprehensive income, and calculation of non-controlling interests (NCI)
  • Subsequent consolidation: NCI calculation for net income and other comprehensive income
  • Acquisitions and partial disposal of investments: elimination of changes in investments and adjustments for group share changes
  • Consolidation method changes: from/to purchase / equity method
  • Capital increases / decreases with no group share change
  • Total divestitures

Note: Other automatic postings, such as eliminations or reclassifications that must be posted at the consolidation group level can also be defined.

 

Rule Type: Postings for Consolidation Groups

Posting rules defined with the rule type Postings for Consolidation Groups can only be assigned, via the rule group, to tasks of category 55 - Automatic Postings for Consolidation Groups. These tasks are processed exclusively from the consolidation monitor.

Posting rules of this type include options tailored for group postings, as described below.

 

Defining Group Structure Filters

In a posting rule, a group structure filter selects units (consolidation units, partner units, investee units) based on their assignment in the current consolidation group defined in the Manage Group Structure app.

Example use cases:

  • Select only consolidation units with purchase method
  • Select only partner units with first consolidation in the current period
  • Select only consolidation units that change their method from equity to purchase

You define group structure filters in the Group Structure Filters tab of the Manage Rules for Automatic Postings app.

You define in the group structure filter how to select the units, using:

  • the consolidation method assigned to the unit (for example, parent, purchase, equity). 
  • the assignment stage of the unit for the current period (for example, first consolidation, subsequent consolidation, divestiture), including whether it applies at the beginning or end of the period.
  • the method changes (from/to) that occur for the consolidation unit in the current period, including whether the change happens at the beginning or end of the period.

The selection of consolidation method, assignment stage, and method change are optional.

For instance, you can select units considering only their method and not their assignment stage, or considering only their method change. However, assignment stages can only be selected when a consolidation method is specified.

Note: In addition to delivered consolidation methods (parent, purchase, equity), you can create your own consolidation methods in the self service configuration Define Consolidation Methods to support further scenarios, such as proportional consolidation or units held for sale.

 

Using Group Structure Filters in Posting Rules

In posting rules of the type Postings for Consolidation Groups, you can assign a group structure filter in the source data section to select consolidation units, partner units and investee units.

This filter is optional. If no filter is assigned, the rule selects all units assigned to the consolidation group.

Example:

A rule that eliminates investments during first consolidation might:

  • Filter consolidation units with a group structure filter PP (consolidation methods: parent, purchase), and
  • Filter partner units with a group structure filter PU_FC (consolidation method: purchase; assignment stage: first consolidation).

By combining the selection objects (for example, FS items, subitems) with the group structure filters (for example, consolidation methods, assignment stages, method changes) across consolidation units, partner units, and investee units in the posting rule definitions allows you to precisely target complex scenarios for automation.

 

Organizing Posting Rules

Automating group postings for consolidation of investments typically requires many rules. To keep them manageable:

  • Use nodes in the rule group to organize rules by method (purchase, equity, for example) and then by assignment stage (first consolidation, subsequent consolidation, investments changes, equity changes, divestiture, for example).

  • Adopt a naming convention that reflects method, assignment stage, and FS items to make the log easier to read and to present posting rules in a logical sequence (see the log example at the end of this blog).

 

Defining Posting Rules

When defining posting rules for the consolidation of investments, consider the aspects mentioned below.

Rounding difference

When defining rules that use variables with percentages (for example, group share, non controlling share), minor rounding differences can create imbalances. To clear this imbalance, add an extra posting line to balance the entry (see posting line #4 below).

Investee Unit

The investee unit field is typically inherited from the partner unit for investment FS items and from the consolidation unit for equity FS items.

This inheritance links investor and investee units for entries related to investment and equity changes.

In a first consolidation posting, this linkage allows the log to display source and posting lines from the investor (investment FS items) and investee (equity FS items) together, improving the understanding of the posting. (see the log example at the end of this blog).

It is therefore important, when defining the posting rule, to ensure that the investee unit field is not cleared. In most cases, it inherits its value from the source data, If needed, it can also be assigned directly in the rule from the consolidation or partner unit using the field assignment section with the Value Of option set to Consolidation Unit or Partner Unit.

 

Displaying the Log

The example below shows how the log can help analyze postings for consolidation of investments. It illustrates also the importance of the naming convention for the rules, and the role of the investee unit field. 

(1) The tab Investee Unit is selected so the investee units are displayed and can be selected in the left pane (2).

(2) The investee unit GDI US West is selected in the left pane. The log items for this investee unit are displayed on the right. They include the investment FS items from investors GDI Spain and GDI France, and equity FS items for the investee unit GDI US West.

The log items are grouped by rule.

The first 2 rules (investments and equity for first consolidation with purchase method) are expanded in this example.

(3) The investments in the investor units are eliminated against retained earnings in the investee unit. Since the investor GDI Spain is not held by 100%, non-controlling interests (NCI) are also posted here. 

(4) The equity in the investee unit is eliminated against the retained earnings, non controlling interests are calculated and posted.

(5) The group share % of the investors and investee unit are displayed as a variable.

When the Investee Units tab is selected, you can click the investee unit in the left pane to open its group structure assignment details:

Note: The examples provided in this blog are simplified to illustrate the features. Other configurations are possible.

More Information

  • Rules for Automatic Postings
  • How to Define Group Structure Filters 
  • Blog Introducing New Rules for Automatic Postings 

Special thanks to MareikeBaudewig for reviewing this blog!

entry.title: Sending JWE/JWS Encrypted JSON Payload from SAP PI/PO to Bank API
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We have a new requirement from one of our banking partners where payment data needs to be sent from SAP PI/PO to the Bankâ€™s API in encrypted and signed JSON format using JWE/JWS standards.

Integration Scenario:

Source: SAP ECC (IDoc)
Existing Flow:  IDoc â†’ SAP PI/PO â†’ SOAP Call
Expected Flow: IDoc â†’ SAP PI/PO â†’ Encrypted JSON â†’ Bank Corporate API

Security Requirements (as provided by the Bank):

Encryption Mechanism: JWE
Key Encryption Algorithm: RSA-OAEP-256
Content Encryption Method: A256GCM
Signing Algorithm: RS256 (JWS)

Request for Feasibility

I would like to understand whether SAP PI/PO (7.5 single stack) can support JWE + JWS encryption/signing using:

Standard REST Adapter capabilities
Custom Adapter Module
Custom java mapping (UDF)
Or any SAP-recommended approach

If custom development is required, please advise:

Whether external libraries (e.g., Nimbus JOSE + JWT) can be deployed on PI/PO: If yes, then where can i get required JAR files.
Any limitations or performance considerations
Recommended best practices for implementing secure REST communication in PI/PO

Any insights, implementation steps, or past experience handling similar requirements would be highly appreciated.

entry.title: Re: Adobe forms: Header paragraph need to repeat every page
entry.content:
The reason it's not working is because the heading will only be repeated within the flowed content as a header if it's set as positioned (and marked as such under overflow of the flowed subform), but you have it set to flowed.  You do have the option of placing it in the master page as noted in the other replies but it is not required.

 

Regards,

Ryan Crosby

entry.title: Whatâ€™s New on My Metrics 2026 Q1 QRC: Schedule a Metrics Report
entry.content:
In my last blog post, I announced the release of scheduled Metrics Reports for 2026 Q1 QRC, and now itâ€™s time to take a closer look at how they help you stay on top of your data.

Keeping an eye on performance metrics is essential but manually checking them can quickly become time-consuming. With scheduled Metrics Reports in My Metrics, you can stay informed without the extra effort. By subscribing to a metrics report, youâ€™ll automatically receive updates on changes in your selected metrics, delivered on a daily, weekly, or monthly schedule. Simply choose the recurrence pattern that works best for you and let the insights come to you right when you need them.

Below is a practical guide to what the feature does, how to set it up, common options, and tips for best results.

Why Subscribe to a Metrics Report?

Subscribing to a metrics report lets you receive regular, automated updates on metric changes without having to manually check stories. It ensures that teams and stakeholders get consistent snapshots of what has changed since the previous report, while giving you control over the delivery cadence and recipients, so insights arrive exactly when theyâ€™re most useful.

What You Need Before You Start 

  • Access to My Metrics and permission to create subscriptions (check your role settings).
  • If you want recurrence based on working days, you must have a working day calendar defined in the underlying model. For details, see Use a Working Day Calendar for Your Series.
  • Only metrics that come from tunnel connection type models are supported in the report (this connection allows controlled exposure of data outside the corporate network). For more information, see Live Data Connections to SAP S/4HANA.
  • This feature is only available in SAP Analytics Cloud tenants running in the Cloud Foundry environment (not available in the Neo environment).

Quick Step-by-Step Setup

  1. Open the metrics list you want to subscribe to in My Metrics.
  2. In list view, choose More (the â€¢â€¢â€¢ / menu) and pick Subscribe to Metrics Report.
  3. In the creation dialog, enter a Subscription Name (mandatory) and a Description (recommended). Note: the name can contain only letters and numbers no special characters. 
  4. Click Next to choose the schedule.
  5. Define the recurrence pattern: Day, Week, or Month. If you use Working Day(s), pick the model that contains your working day calendar:
    • Day
      • Choose Day(s) or Working Day(s) and enter the frequency number (e.g., every 2 days).
      • If you choose Working Day(s), select the model and calendar to define non-working days
    • Week
      • Set the number of weeks between reports.
      • Choose one or more weekdays to run the report, or select Working Day and pick an ordinal working day (first, second, third, fourth, or last) from the calendar.
      • When using Working Day, select the appropriate model and calendar if more than one is available. 
    • Month
      • Day option: specify a day number (1â€“31). If the month has fewer days than the number you entered, the report runs on the monthâ€™s last day.
      • Working Day option: enter a frequency number or choose an ordinal working day (first, second, third, fourth, or last) of the month; select the model/calendar if required.
      • You can also schedule by â€œnth weekdayâ€ (for example, the second Tuesday of each month).
      • Examples: entering -2 schedules the report for the second-to-last day of the month; entering 31 schedules it on the monthâ€™s last day. 
  6. Set the planned start date and time and when the recurrence should end (by end date or number of occurrences).
  7. Click Next and add at least one recipient in the Distribution List. You can select existing users or teams.
  8. Optionally uncheck â€œSend email notificationsâ€ if you prefer in-app notifications onlybelow an example of an email notification of a Metrics Report:                                                                                                 
  9. Save to create the subscription.

Other Important Details and Limitations

  • Each metrics report can include up to 15 metrics.
  • The report only includes metrics that have changed since their last recorded value, this focuses recipients on recent movement.
  • Sent reports are also accessible from in-app notifications.
  • If you set recurrence on working day calendars, no report is sent on non-working days defined by that calendar.

Manage subscriptions

Manage Subscriptions lets recipients control how they interact with a metrics report and lets owners copy, edit, or delete subscriptions. Recipients can copy a subscription or change their notification settings; only the subscription owner can edit or delete it. You can also preview subscription details from the Manage Subscriptions dialog. Note that you need the correct permissions to perform these actions.

Accessing and filtering subscriptions

  • Open the metrics list in My Metrics, then choose More â†’ Manage Subscriptions.
  • Use the filter to show Active Subscriptions (default) or switch to All Subscriptions to see inactive ones as well. This helps you quickly find the subscription you want to manage.

Copying a subscription

  • Select a subscription in the Manage Subscriptions dialog and choose Copy Subscription.
  • When you copy a subscription you duplicate its details but can change schedule or recipients. You become the owner of the new copy and it is independent of the original.

Modifying your notification settings

Recipients can mute or resume notifications for a subscription without affecting others. Steps:

  • Open the subscription, choose Notification Settings, then pick:
    • Resume Notifications
    • Mute Until: select a date and time to pause notifications until then
    • Mute All Scheduled Reports
  • Save changes. Your choices apply only to your account and wonâ€™t change other recipientsâ€™ settings.

Editing a subscription (owner only)

Owners can edit name, description, schedule, and distribution list. Steps:

  • Open Manage Subscriptions, select the subscription, choose Edit Subscription, make changes, and save.
  • Note: changing a subscription may trigger a new report schedule; recipients will be affected by edits.

Deleting a subscription (owner only)

  • Owners can delete one or more subscriptions from the Manage Subscriptions dialog.
  • Deletion removes all recipients and cancels scheduled reports. Confirm deletion in the warning dialog to proceed.

Previewing subscription details

  • In Manage Subscriptions, select a subscription to view its details (description, schedule, end date, owner, distribution list).
  • Use Preview to verify settings before copying, editing, or deleting.

Best Practices

Use descriptive subscription names in the Description field to clearly communicate the purpose and intended audience, since the subscription name itself supports only alphanumeric characters. Before rolling it out broadly, test the subscription with a small group of recipients to validate the timing and content. If your reports depend on working days, make sure the modelâ€™s working day calendar is correctly configured and that the appropriate calendar is selected when multiple options are available. Finally, choose notification channels thoughtfully, use in-app notifications for teams working primarily in SAC, and enable email notifications for external stakeholders or wider visibility.

You can quickly find and act on the correct subscriptions by using filters, making it easier to manage them efficiently. If you need similar reports, you can copy an existing subscription without changing the original setup. Notifications can be muted temporarily when a report is sent too frequently and resumed later as needed. To prevent confusion, owners should clearly communicate any edits or deletions to recipients. If management options are not visible, itâ€™s important to verify permissions, as available actions depend on assigned roles.

Troubleshooting Tips

  • If recipients donâ€™t receive reports, confirm youâ€™re on a Cloud Foundry tenant and that recipientsâ€™ email addresses or user accounts are correct.
  • If a metric you expect is missing, check that itâ€™s based on a tunnel connection type model and that it changed since the last report.
  • If the schedule doesnâ€™t behave as expected with working days, review the modelâ€™s working day calendar and the selected calendar if multiple calendars are maintained.
  • If you canâ€™t edit or delete a subscription, confirm you are the owner and have the required role.
  • If notifications donâ€™t change after updating settings, re-open Manage Subscriptions to confirm your saved preferences.
  • If recipients stop receiving reports after edits, check the distribution list and schedule settings.

Wrapping Up

Subscribing to a metrics report in My Metrics is a simple way to keep stakeholders informed about metric changes with flexible scheduling and notification options. With attention to the working day settings and model selection, you can align report delivery to business calendars and avoid unnecessary messages on non-working days.

entry.title: Settlement periods & Billing Date period of service contract on billing document (S4 Public Cloud)
entry.content:
Hello,

I have the following problem with service contracts and the resulting invoices:
In the service contract, I maintain a billing plan in item 10.
There, I enter the billing date as half-yearly and settlement period monthly or half-yearly.
However, the order quantity is 1 month for the first item.
When I create an invoice request and then the invoice, the order quantity of 1 month is shown on the billing document.
However, since I have specified a billing period of monthly or half-yearly in the service contract, and in particular a half-yearly billing date, I would like to have 6 months on the billing document for the corresponding invoice, in accordance with the billing date.
Do you have a solution?

Service Contract:

Quantity: 1 Month

Billing Plan in position 10 of Service Contract:

Settlement Period: Monthly

Billing date: Half-Yearly

Invoice for the first billing plan date: 

Billing document:

Quantity: 1, instead of 6 - because of the billing period half-yearly

I am missing the settlement period and the billing Date of the service contract in the invoice.

Thank you in advance.

Kind regards

Jannik

entry.title: Using SuccessFactors Onboarding for Country Transfers Without Recruiting
entry.content:
In this article, we discuss how employees who are moving to a legal entity in another country can be onboarded using SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding, without SuccessFactors Recruiting.

The scenario covered here is a country transfer, not a global assignment. The employeeâ€™s employment in the source country ends, and a new employment is created in the target country.

Scenario Description

  • Current country: India
  • Target country: United States
  • Movement type: Country Transfer (not Global Assignment)
  • SuccessFactors Recruiting: Not used
  • Identity Authentication Service (IAS): Enabled
  • Onboarding module: Used for New Hire / Rehire

In this scenario, the employee will be treated as a new hire in the USA, while their employment in India is terminated.

Before we look at this process let us reconfirm the process with SuccessFactors Recruiting.

When onboarding is initiated from SuccessFactors Recruiting, the first â€˜Rehire Checkâ€™ is initiated, this will trigger an employment profile selection check for the rehire co-ordinators.

They will only be able to confirm â€˜Rehire on New Employmentâ€™ if the current â€˜Indiaâ€™ record has a termination date that is before the hire date on the new â€˜USAâ€™ employment.    

Once they confirm â€˜Rehire with New Employmentâ€™ an email is sent to the employee asking them to complete the onboarding process using the employment profile switcher in the top right corner as shown below.

If the employee has not applied for a role in SuccessFactors Recruiting, and SuccessFactors Recruiting is enabled, it is best practice to quickly create a requisition and add the employee to it so that the process is initiated as above.

If you do not have SuccessFactors Recruiting, then the following is a process that can be used.

The first rehire check is only initiated from SuccessFactors Recruiting, it will not trigger from â€˜Add a new hire to onboardingâ€™, this is on the roadmap but does not have a delivery date.

Step 1 â€“ Initiate onboarding using â€˜Add New Hire to Onboardingâ€™

It is imperative that the email that is used is the personal email address and not the business email address.  The reason for this is the business email address is active in IAS.  You can use â€˜business rulesâ€™ in onboarding to send out a specific welcome email for â€˜Country Transfersâ€™.

Dear XX

As we start your transfer we would like you to complete some basic information, once we have this we can use this data to allow you to finalize your transfer in SuccessFactorsâ€¦..

Step 2 â€“ Employee receives IAS email

Employee receives the IAS email to their personal email address and completes Personal Data Collection.

Step 3 â€“ Rehire re-verification is triggered  

The second rehire verification is triggered.  The rehire co-ordinators can confirm a Rehire if there is a termination date on the India employment that is before the hire date of the USA employment.

Without termination date

With termination date

Step 4 â€“ Legal Entity Transfer email is sent

Once the rehire is accepted the onboarding system sends the â€˜legal entity transferâ€™ email to the business email address.  The system allows the employee to finish the onboarding process using the â€˜employment profile switcherâ€™.  Once they finish the onboarding process they land in Manage Pending Hires.

 

This process allows â€˜Country Transferâ€™ to complete onboarding when SuccessFactors Recruiting is not enabled.

entry.title: â€ŒðŸ‡«ðŸ‡·â€Œ B2B E-invoicing and E-reporting with SAP Document and Reporting Compliance
entry.content:
Join our localization experts for an inâ€‘depth session focused on the latest regulatory developments for Franceâ€™s upcoming B2B eâ€‘invoicing and eâ€‘reporting requirements. During this webinar, you will gain a clear understanding of how these new obligations align with SAP Document and Reporting Compliance.

entry.title: Producer Event Mesh IFlow
entry.content:
Hi,

I would like for your opinion regarding designing producer's iflow for asynchronous data publishing and consumption. 
The general idea is to have integration flow that will iterate every 15 minutes over the list of datacenters and query Prometheus logs for every datacenter and then publish the data to the event mesh queue. That would be the producer iflow. Then, the consumer iflow would use the event mesh queue as the sender and push the messages to the FAST API application. 

So far I have been focusing on the producer design. It has the following steps:
1. Timer (trigger every 15 minutes)
2. Content Modifier (body with the landscape list)
3. Groovy script that reads the list
4. Iterator splitter (sequentially processing each landscape from the list)
5. Query Prometheus for each landscape id and build the topic property corresponding to the current landscape
6. Request Reply from the query
7. Publish the message to the event mesh queue
8. AMQP receiver adapter to connect to the queue
I would like your humble opinion on this design. I tested it and it works fine, the messages arrive to the queue and I can use Postman or Bruno to consume them. 
This is the setup with one queue and multiple topic subscriptions within the queue corresponding to each landscape id.
What do you think of this setup? I am using SAP Event Mesh and average message size can be from 2-5 MB depending on the size of the datacenter.

Thank you!

entry.title: Re: MFS - HU at the end of the automatic storage retrieva...
entry.content:
Hi,

 

from my point of view, the root cause of the issue is that you only have a waiting WT to move the HU to the next CP.
Because the WT is still in waiting/inactive status no subsystem relevance status is set in the WT and therefore the /SCWM/MFS_WT_DET_PREP will log the message "HU at the end of the automatic storage retrieval; sending not required. Technically, this corresponds to message /SCWM/MFS 230.

This message is being logged when you have  open/waiting WT with no subsystem relevance and your CP is either marked as an end point or a NIO-CP:

Whether a WT is subsystem-relevant depends on the queue determination. A WT only receives subsystem relevance "Yâ€ if an MFS queue is determined:

The queue determination is only executed if 
  • your waiting WT will be set to active as the LOSC has no more intermediate bin needed
  • the LOSC finds the next intermediate bin and creates a new active WT to this intermediate bin
 
Therefore, you should check your LOSC customizing to understand why you end up with only a waiting WT instead of 
  • an active WT
  • or a newly created active WT to the intermediate bin + the remaining waiting/inactive WT to the final destination

entry.title: Meet â€œThe Concierge of SAPâ€: How Helping Others Sparked a Global Journey
entry.content:
It started with a suitcase. 

As a teenager working as a bellboy in a seaside hotel in Mexico, Ricardo Resendiz had no idea he was learning the skill that would define his future: helping others. He did not know what a concierge was, yet he was already doing the job: securing restaurant reservations, finding event tickets, and solving problems with a smile. That same instinct to serve would later earn him a global reputation as "The Concierge of SAP." 

Today, Ricardo is a Software Engineer and SAP Integration Consultant, recognized across the SAP Community for his generosity, curiosity, and enthusiasm for learning. But his journey to that point was anything but straightforward. 

His story with SAP solutions began in 2006. A few years later, a manager challenged him to â€œmake more merits.â€ Seeing it as an opportunity, he committed to structured SAP ABAP training through an SAP Authorized Education Partner, an experience that led to his first SAP Certification.

A decade later, Ricardo found himself facing uncertainty once again. Despite years of experience, he was rejected from SAP S/4HANA projects because he lacked the â€œrightâ€ qualifications. That moment of frustration became a turning point. Determined to build skills that could not be overlooked, he began studying independently through SAP Learning Hub, diving into courses, hands-on practice environments, and certification-focused preparation materials. 

â€œThat period completely reignited my career. The structure and flexibility of SAP enablement helped me learn faster than I imagined.â€ 

Then, in 2023, everything began to fall into place again. A LinkedIn post about a new SAP Certification caught his attention, prompting him to dive into the dedicated learning journey on the SAP Learning site. 

The path was not without challenges. Just before the exam, Ricardo lost his grandmother. While grieving, he postponed the test several times, until his exam window was nearly over. With only days left, he gathered his focus, studied relentlessly, and passed his ABAP Cloud Certification on the first attempt. 

Energized by both the learning experience and his success, Ricardo then brought others together by creating a study group and leading one of the cells himself. Becoming the first in the group to earn the certification helped set the tone for the journey, sparking momentum and a strong sense of shared progress. 

â€œThose learning journeys and hands-on exercises were invaluable. They gave me everything I needed to keep going.â€ 

Two and a half years ago, that same perseverance found a new outlet: LinkedIn. What began as a way to manage anxiety became something much larger. His thoughtful posts, blending insights, humor, and personal stories, quickly resonated with readers. People began seeking advice on resumes, profiles, and career development. Helping them felt natural. 

That generosity became his signature. Today, Ricardoâ€™s Concierge persona has made him a familiar presence online and at technology events, where people often approach him to say, â€œI follow you on LinkedInâ€ or â€œI love your posts.â€ 

His proudest moments, though, happen at home. â€œEvery time I pass a certification exam, I walk downstairs and tell my wife and daughters, â€˜I did it.â€™ That is what really makes me happy.â€ 

From carrying luggage in a hotel lobby to helping others carry their ambitions in the SAP ecosystem, Ricardo Resendizâ€™s story is proof that curiosity, service, and continuous learning can take you anywhere. 

â€œStart now. Learn every day. Even small steps matter.â€ â€œThe best moment to start learning was yesterday, the second one is nowâ€.  

Ready to start your SAP journey? Discover structured learning and certifications on SAP Learning site and see how enablement turns curiosity into confidence.

entry.title: Re: How to use BAPI_SALESORDER_CHANGE properly? Encounter...
entry.content:
• BAPI_SALESORDER_CHANGE requires consistent header structures:
    • ORDER_HEADER_IN must contain the values you want to change.
    • ORDER_HEADER_INX must mark those fields with 'X' and set UPDATEFLAG = 'U'.
  • If you pass incomplete or inconsistent data (e.g., only one field with UPDATEFLAG = 'U' but no other mandatory header fields), the BAPI can raise a runtime error.
  • The sales document number you pass (lv_salesdocnum) must be a sales order, not a contract. The BAPI cannot update contracts directly.

entry.title: SAP Datasphere - SQL Views as SQL Script â€“ Automatic generation of columns in the left side pane
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I am working with SQL Views using SQLScript (Table Function) in SAP Datasphere and noticed that the output columns must always be created manually in the Model Properties â†’ Columns section before the SQLScript can be validated or deployed.

Even when the SQLScript contains a simple RETURN SELECT ... statement, Datasphere does not automatically generate the column definitions based on the SQL result. As far as I can see, this is different from standard SQL views, where column inference works automatically.

My questions:

  1. Is there any way to automatically generate the output columns in the left side panel when using SQLScript (Table Function) in SAP Datasphere?
  2. If not:
    • Is this a current technical limitation?
    • Is there any roadmap indicating that automatic column generation will be supported in the future?

Context / What I tried:

  • SQLScript with RETURN SELECT ...
  • SQLScript with table variables
  • Validation to trigger autoâ€‘generation
  • Switching between SQL Standard and SQLScript

In all cases, Datasphere requires me to manually maintain the business/technical names and data types in the Model Properties panel before validation succeeds.

Example SQLScript:

return

with "cte_customers" as (
    select
        "id",
        "name"
    from "customers"
)

, "cte_customers_ranked" as (
    select
        "id",
        "name",
        1 as "rank_number"
    from "cte_customers"
)

select
    "id",
    "name",
    "rank_number"
from "cte_customers_ranked";

Expected behavior (wish):

Some way to autoâ€‘populate the column list based on the SQLScript output (similar to SQL Standard views).

Actual behavior:

Columns must be fully defined manually, otherwise validation fails.

If anyone has additional insight, workaround ideas, or official SAP statements regarding this behavior, I would really appreciate it.

Thank you.

Kind regards,
Anna

 

Clicking Validate for the following statement automatically generates the column ID:
tab =
select
    "id" AS ID
from "customers";

return
select ID from :tab;

 

Clicking Validate for the following statement does not automatically generate the column ID:
tab = with "cte1" (ID) as (
    select
        "id" AS ID
    from "customers"
)
select ID from "cte1";

return
select ID from :tab;

 

Is there an issue with the WITH clause?

entry.title: SAP TM Report /SCMTMS/TOR_CORR_ITEM_RES_CHK - Resource RelevantÂ forÂ TimeÂ Check
entry.content:
Introduction

Resource time check relevancy issues in SAP Transportation Management (TM) can significantly impact operational efficiency and system performance. Two critical OSS notes - 3194872 and 3207567 - address fundamental problems with how the system handles resource time checks for executed documents and status changes. These corrections are essential for organizations using SAP TM to manage transportation resources effectively, particularly those experiencing Transportation Cockpit performance issues or incorrect resource conflict errors. This blog post targets SAP TM administrators, basis consultants, and functional consultants responsible for transportation management implementations.

 

OSS Notes Overview

Note 3194872: Incorrect resource time check relevancy of Executed Documents

Release Information:

  • SAP Transportation Management (TM)
  • Component: /SCMTMS/D_TORITE table
  • Severity level: High - impacts resource allocation and system performance

Problem Description: The system incorrectly maintains resource time check relevancy for documents with execution status 'Executed'. When a single vehicle resource is assigned to an executed Freight Document, the system continues to treat it as relevant for resource time checks. This causes false positive error messages stating "Resource &1 is already used by &2 within this time frame" when attempting to assign the same resource to another Freight Document, preventing document saves or setting unnecessary execution blocks.

Business Impact:

  • Operational delays due to incorrect resource conflict errors
  • Inability to properly reuse resources after execution completion
  • Increased manual intervention required for resource management
  • Reduced system efficiency and user productivity

Note 3207567: Incorrect resource time check relevancy after status changes

Release Information:

  • SAP Transportation Management (TM)
  • Component: Transportation document lifecycle management
  • Severity level: High - affects document status transitions

Problem Description: When Freight Documents transition from 'Completed' or 'Executed' status back to 'In Process' or 'In Execution', the resource time check relevancy incorrectly remains set to 'Completed' instead of reverting to 'Relevant'. This creates inconsistencies in resource availability checks and can lead to improper resource allocation decisions.

Business Impact:

  • Inconsistent resource availability calculations
  • Potential overallocation or under-utilization of resources
  • Incorrect planning decisions based on faulty resource status
  • Transportation Cockpit performance degradation with large document volumes

Root Cause Analysis

Technical Background: The core issue stems from improper handling of the RES_TIME_CHECK_REL field in table /SCMTMS/D_TORITE for AVR (Arrival) and PVR (Departure) items. The system fails to correctly update this field when document statuses change, leading to persistent resource time check relevancy even after execution completion. This particularly impacts the Transportation Cockpit's class *TOR_A_CHECK, which experiences significant runtime slowdowns when processing more than 500 documents with incorrect time check settings.

Common Scenarios:

  • High-volume transportation operations with frequent resource reuse
  • Documents undergoing multiple status transitions during their lifecycle
  • Transportation Cockpit usage with large document datasets
  • Automated resource allocation processes that depend on accurate status information

Solution Implementation

Pre-Implementation Checklist

  • Create complete system backup before applying corrections
  • Schedule maintenance window for correction instruction implementation
  • Notify users of potential temporary system unavailability
  • Identify all affected transportation documents for correction
  • Prepare rollback plan in case of implementation issues

Step-by-Step Implementation

  1. Apply Correction Instructions
    • Download and implement attached correction instructions for both notes
    • Alternatively, apply for the corresponding Support Packages if available
    • Verify successful implementation through system logs
    • Restart relevant application servers if required
  2. Execute Correction Report
    • Run report /SCMTMS/TOR_CORR_ITEM_RES_CHK to correct existing documents
    • For Note 3194872: Use parameters P_SIM (simulation mode) and P_LOG (show documents) for initial testing
    • For Note 3207567: Configure additional parameters:
      • P_COMPL: Set time check to Completed for executed documents
      • P_RELEV: Set time check to Relevant for documents in execution/process
    • Execute in production mode after successful simulation

Validation and Testing

Test Scenarios:

  • Scenario 1: Assign a resource to an executed Freight Document, then attempt to assign the same resource to a new document - should succeed without error messages
  • Scenario 2: Change document status from Executed back to In Process - resource time check relevancy should automatically update too Relevant
  • Scenario 3: Load more than 500 documents in Transportation Cockpit - performance should be improved with corrected time check settings

Success Criteria:

  • Elimination of false positive resource conflict errors
  • Proper resource time check relevancy updates during status transitions
  • Improved Transportation Cockpit performance with large document volumes
  • Successful resource reuse after document execution completion

Business Impact

Before Implementation

  • Frequent false resource conflict errors disrupting operations
  • Manual workarounds required for resource allocation
  • Transportation Cockpit performance issues with large datasets
  • Inconsistent resource availability information affecting planning

After Implementation

  • Streamlined resource allocation without false conflicts
  • Automatic and accurate resource time check relevancy updates
  • Enhanced Transportation Cockpit performance and user experience
  • Reliable resource availability data for improved planning decisions

Best Practices and Recommendations

Implementation Tips:

  • Always test corrections in development environment first
  • Execute the correction report during low-activity periods
  • Monitor system performance before and after implementation
  • Document all parameter settings used for future reference

Ongoing Maintenance:

  • Regularly monitor Transportation Cockpit performance metrics
  • Schedule periodic execution of correction reports for data quality
  • Include these corrections in future system upgrade planning
  • Establish monitoring for resource time check relevancy accuracy

Related Resources

Additional OSS Notes:

  • 3168764: Message display issues after save operations
  • 3408674: Resource check errors with identical timeframes
  • 3337830: Resource status change validation enhancements

Documentation Links:

  • SAP Transportation Management Help Portal
  • Transportation Cockpit performance optimization guides
  • Resource management configuration documentation

Conclusion

Implementing OSS notes 3194872 and 3207567 is crucial for maintaining optimal SAP TM performance and ensuring accurate resource management. These corrections eliminate critical issues that can significantly impact daily transportation operations and system efficiency. Organizations should prioritize implementing these corrections, especially those experiencing Transportation Cockpit performance issues or resource allocation conflicts. The provided correction report /SCMTMS/TOR_CORR_ITEM_RES_CHK offers a comprehensive solution for addressing both existing and future document issues.

 Refer:

3194872 Incorrect resource time check relevancy of Executed Documents

 3207567 Incorrect resource time check relevancy after status changes

Hope that can help you.

Thanks, and regards

Rogerio Lima.

entry.title: Discover and Publish Advanced Event Mesh Events and APIs in SAP Developer Hub
entry.content:
In todayâ€™s digital economy, event-driven architectures (EDA) enable real-time insights and seamless integration across diverse system landscapesâ€”whether connecting SAP applications or extending integration to third-party solutions. Organizations can now more efficiently discover, publish, and consume events and APIs, empowering both developers and integration architects.

In this blog, weâ€™ll explore what these capabilities mean in practice, how to connect Advanced Event Mesh with Developer Hub, and how to publish events from business systems into a centralized discovery catalogâ€”bringing event-driven integration patterns into the mainstream of enterprise integration design.

Create a Destination to Connect Advanced Event Mesh with SAP Developer Hub

To enable the discovery and publication of events from Advanced Event Mesh in Developer Hub, the first step is to establish a secure connection between the two services. This connection is configured using a destination in SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP).

In the following sections, weâ€™ll explain the purpose of this destination and walk through the key configuration details required to set it up successfully.

Why is a Destination Required?

A destination serves as the secure connectivity bridge between Developer Hub and your Advanced Event Mesh (AEM) instance. This connection is essential for Developer Hub to discover EventAPIs within AEM and display them as Events in the central catalog.

Note: In the current release, the destination is used exclusively for the discovery phase of the event lifecycle.

Create the Destination in SAP BTP

1. To create the destination, log in to SAP BTP Cockpit and navigate to the source subaccount where Developer Hub is enabled.

2. From the left navigation pane, go to Connectivity â†’ Destinations and choose Create. Select From Scratch to manually define a new destination.

3. In the Destination Details section, enter all required information:

  • Name: Provide a unique and meaningful name for the destination.
  • Type: Choose HTTP as the destination type.
  • Description: Provide a brief description of the Advanced Event Mesh (AEM) system. This description appears for the AEM business system in Developer Hub.
  • URL: Enter the base URL of your Advanced Event Mesh portal.           
  • For authentication, choose BasicAuthentication.
               Username: Enter the username of the technical user. This can be an email address.
               Password: Use an API token generated from the Advanced Event Mesh portal as the password.
  • When creating the API token, ensure that the following permissions are assigned: a. Read any Application Domain (application_domain:get:*) b. Do anything to any Event API (event_api:*:*) c. Access to Event Portal Designer (event_designer:access). These permissions allow Developer Hub to read event definitions and interact with the Event portal.
  • Enter the Additional Settings: Choose Internet as the Proxy Type.
  • Add the following custom property to enable Advanced Event Mesh support in Developer Hub:  Key: sap.isuite.dh.aem.enabled Value: true              

4. Validate the destination.

After entering all details, choose Create.
You can optionally use Check Connection to verify that the destination has been configured correctly, and that Developer Hub can successfully connect to Advanced Event Mesh.

Whatâ€™s Next?

Once the destination is set up, Developer Hub can start discovering events from Advanced Event Mesh. These events can then be reviewed, published, and made available to developers through the central catalog.

This simple setup step lays the foundation for enabling event-driven integration using SAP Integration Suite.

Discover and Publish Events from Advanced Event Mesh on Developer Hub

Once the destination between Advanced Event Mesh and SAP Developer Hub is in place, you can start making events available to developers by discovering and publishing them in Developer Hub.

This step is typically performed by a content administrator, who curates events and organizes them into products for easy discovery and reuse.

Before You Begin

To discover and publish events, make sure the following prerequisites are met:

  • You are assigned the AuthGroup.Content.Admin role collection.
  • EventAPIs are marked as shared in the Advanced Event Mesh portal.

Only shared events can be added to products and published in Developer Hub. If an event is not shared, update its settings in the Advanced Event Mesh portal before proceeding.

Discover Events in Developer Hub

  1. Log on to Developer Hub and navigate to Admin Center â†’ Manage â†’ Content. Here, youâ€™ll see a list of available business systems. Select the Advanced Event Mesh business system to discover events exposed from it.
  2. Events in Advanced Event Mesh are organized under application domains. When you select an application domain, all events associated with that domain are displayed.
  3. If required, you can enable the option to Show shared events from other domains. This allows you to view and reuse events that have been shared across application domains.

Understand Event Visibility

Each application domain contains its own set of events:

  • Shared events are visible across all application domains.
  • Non-shared events are visible only within their own domain.

Only shared events can be added to a product in Developer Hub. This ensures that events intended for broader consumption are clearly identified and reusable.

  1. After selecting the relevant events, you can group them into a product. Products help organize events logically and make them easier for developers to discover.
  2. When creating a product, you can include:
  • Shared events from the current application domain
  • Shared events from other application domains

       This flexibility allows you to design products that align with business capabilities rather than technical boundaries.

3. Publish the product

           Once the product details are reviewed, you can choose how to proceed:

  • Save as Draft
    Keeps the product in a draft state. Draft products are not visible in the catalog and can be published later.
  • Publish
    Makes the product visible in the Developer Hub catalog so developers can discover it.
    Published products are discoverable but not yet available for subscription.

 

What Happens Next?

After publishing, your events are visible in Developer Hub and ready to be explored by developers. This enables teams to quickly understand available event streams and build event-driven applications or integrations using Advanced Event Mesh.

Together with the destination setup, this completes the core flow for exposing Advanced Event Mesh events through Developer Hub.

This approach helps organizations promote event reuse, improve discoverability, and simplify adoption of event-driven integration patterns across the landscape. 

Final Thoughts

SAP Integration Suiteâ€™s Advanced Event Mesh paired with Developer Hub empowers organizations to treat events as first-class citizens in integration landscapes.

By connecting Advanced Event Mesh to Developer Hub and publishing your event sources and APIs, you:

  • Promote transparency of event streams
  • Enable faster development cycles
  • Support modern application patterns that rely on real-time business context

Whether youâ€™re driving integrations for ERP, CRM, third-party SaaS systems, or custom applications, this capability helps you move from point-to-point communication to a flexible, scalable event-driven architecture.

entry.title: Re: SAP Datasphere - SQL Views as SQL Script â€“ Automatic...
entry.content:
Hey Anna,

The short answer is that the SQL editor is very - ehm - simple (but I'm sure it has a great personality).
The Editor will try to derive the columns from whatever it finds immediately after the "Return" statement. 
It will put no effort into it, and any logic between the output and the source will break it. 

An example:

Any kind of obfuscation between the editor and the source tables will result in the editor throwing it's hands in the air. 

Here is a really basic example with a simple temp table between the source and the output:

Even this simple script confuses the poor things. 
It does derive the columns, but everything is cast as a string(100).

Adding a new "Ranking" column, which is clearly an integer, will still result in a string(100).

A workaround (not really).

If you already have an object with the structure you want; one thing that makes it less-awful, it to add a 

return select * from source

And validate. That will generate the structure and derive the schema correctly. 

You can then write your script on top, and replace the "Return" statement later.
This is shaky at best, but it's the least awful way I found.

entry.title: Re: CREATION OF TRANSFER ORDER FROM A PROJECT DEMAND
entry.content: In Public Cloud, there is no out-of-the-box setting to automatically create a transfer order if stock exists and a purchase order if not. You can achieve this by configuring Stock Transport Orders (STO) or aATP substitution rules, or by implementing custom logic via BAdI.
